James Turrell Passageways, a film by Carine Asscher (1995)

Pilot for many years, James Turrell is today the greatest american Land Art artist, and considers the sky as his own studio. Upon spectacular and historical aerial images of Arizona's canyons, Turrell recalls his formal research on natural light and his friendship with the Hopi Indians.
